comment.body:
@Testingzeronet12: Anonymity is not currently provided (because it hasn't been implemented yet). I would recommend reading this blog post – https://blog.maidsafe.net/2016/06/23/introduction-technical-overview-of-safe-consensus/ – and also this one – https://metaquestions.me/2016/07/20/data-chains-what-why-how/ – to get a better understanding of SAFE.

Now that the alpha is released, the core team is going to focus on implementing disjoint groups and data chains. See this post for more details: https://safenetforum.org/t/safe-network-alpha-release/10687/19

@Jayofthezero: SAFE currently lacks a few important features such as data chains – https://github.com/dirvine/data_chain/blob/master/docs/0029-data-chains.md – so I would say that it's a bit too early to compare it to other projects such as Tor, ZeroNet and IPFS.

As a starting point, I would recommend reading this blog post to get an idea of what makes SAFE different: https://blog.maidsafe.net/2016/06/23/introduction-technical-overview-of-safe-consensus/
